com.thinkaurelius.titan.graphdb.database.serialize

Interface OrderPreservingSerializer<V>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AttributeHandler<V>, AttributeSerializer<V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDecimal.AbstractDecimalSerializer, BooleanSerializer, ByteSerializer, CharacterSerializer, DateSerializer, Decimal.DecimalSerializer, IntegerSerializer, LongSerializer, Precision.PrecisionSerializer, ShortSerializer, StringSerializer

    public interface OrderPreservingSerializer<V>
extends AttributeSerializer<V>
    Interface that extends AttributeSerializer to provide a serialization that is byte order preserving, i.e. the order of the elements (as given by its Comparable implementation) corresponds to the natural order of the serialized byte representation representation.
    Author:
    Matthias Broecheler (me@matthiasb.com)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      V readByteOrder(ScanBuffer buffer)
      Reads an attribute from the given ReadBuffer assuming it was written in byte order.
      void writeByteOrder(WriteBuffer buffer, V attribute)
      Writes the attribute value to the given WriteBuffer such that the byte order of the result is equal to the natural order of the attribute.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.thinkaurelius.titan.core.attribute.AttributeSerializer

        read, write

      • Methods inherited from interface com.thinkaurelius.titan.core.attribute.AttributeHandler

        convert, verifyAttribute

    • Method Detail

      • readByteOrder

        V readByteOrder(ScanBuffer buffer)
        Reads an attribute from the given ReadBuffer assuming it was written in byte order.

        It is expected that this read operation adjusts the position in the ReadBuffer to after the attribute value.

        Parameters:
        buffer - ReadBuffer to read attribute from
        Returns:
        Read attribute

      • writeByteOrder

        void writeByteOrder(WriteBuffer buffer,
                  V attribute)
        Writes the attribute value to the given WriteBuffer such that the byte order of the result is equal to the natural order of the attribute.

        It is expected that this write operation adjusts the position in the WriteBuffer to after the attribute value.

        Parameters:
        buffer - WriteBuffer to write attribute to
        attribute - Attribute to write to WriteBuffer
